title: S5 Ep11: Women's liberation, household revolution
itunes:title: Women's liberation, household revolution
description: Until the second half of the 19th century, coverture laws granted married men almost unlimited power over the household. Moshe Hazan and David Weiss tell Tim Phillips about how abolition changed the number of children in a family, and how well those children were educated?
itunes:author: VoxTalks
dc:creator: VoxTalks
